macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Market Rebounds with Broad-Based Gains
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.53% to 6,915 points on December 23, 2025, with the Nasdaq gaining roughly 0.5% and the Dow adding around 180 points. Technology and energy stocks led the advance, with megacaps like Nvidia (+2.5%), Broadcom (+2.2%), Alphabet (+1.3%), and Amazon (+1.3%) driving gains.

items.title: Treasury Yields Decline Amid Market Activity
items.summary: The 10-year Treasury yield fell to 4.15% from 4.19%, reflecting broader market movements during the week of December 22, 2025.

items.title: Sector Performance: Consumer Discretionary and Technology Lead
items.summary: Consumer discretionary stocks rose 1.0% led by Tesla and travel stocks, while technology gained 0.5% driven by AI semiconductor stocks. Healthcare and materials also posted gains of 0.6% each, while financials declined 0.2%.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Slips to $87,644 Amid 0.76% Daily Decline and Tax-Loss Selling
items.summary: The CoinDesk Bitcoin Price Index fell 0.76% to $87,644.80 on December 23, down 4.04% month-to-date and 6.18% year-to-date, with analysts attributing declines to tax-loss selling and crypto stocks suffering steeper drops.[4][7]

items.title: Bitcoin Whales Sell Record $15 Billion in 2025, Signaling Potential 2026 Price Crash
items.summary: Bitcoin whales offloaded a record 161,294 BTC worth about $15 billion throughout 2025, raising concerns over further price corrections into 2026 despite retail accumulation absorbing some pressure.[3]

items.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs Record Persistent Outflows as Institutional Demand Weakens
items.summary: Bitcoin ETFs saw a net outflow of $142.19 million on December 23, extending negative flows for over six weeks, while Ethereum ETFs also face sustained withdrawals amid year-end de-risking.[6]

items.title: VanEck Report Highlights Bitcoin Volatility but Bullish Signals Amid Miner Challenges
items.summary: Bitcoin endured a turbulent December with a 9% price drop and 4% hash rate decline due to regulatory pressures on miners, yet improving liquidity and long-term holder conviction offer optimism.[1]

items.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Under Technical Pressure, Risk Further Declines to $75K and $2,250
items.summary: Bitcoin at $88,480 and Ethereum at $3,005 face downtrend resumption risks below key resistances, potentially retesting lows of $75,000 and $2,250 amid year-to-date losses of 5.25% and 9.80%.[2]

items.title: Crypto Stocks Plunge as Bitcoin Dips Below $88,000 on Tax-Loss Harvesting
items.summary: Bitcoin slipped over 1% to below $88,000 on December 23, with crypto-related stocks experiencing far larger declines driven by tax-loss selling ahead of year-end.[7]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: RIKEN Team Uses Deep Learning to Discover Rare Double-Lambda Hypernucleus
items.summary: Researchers at RIKEN in Japan applied deep learning to analyze nuclear emulsion data from the J-PARC E07 experiment, identifying a new double-Lambda hypernucleus of boron-13 for the first time in 25 years. The method processed just 0.2% of data, estimating over 2,000 more events in the full dataset.

items.title: Federated AI Learning Implemented at Three US National Labs
items.summary: News Bytes highlight recent developments including federated AI learning at three US national labs, alongside high-stakes supercomputing for trading and perspectives from AI 'doomers'. This covers key HPC-AI advancements in the past day.

items.title: Future of AI Hinges on High-Quality Data, Not Just Data Centers
items.summary: In a Stansberry Investor Hour discussion on December 23, 2025, New Constructs CEO David Trainer emphasized that AI's progress depends on clean, high-quality data over infrastructure, with Google Cloud selecting them for AI agent FinSights.

items.title: CISA Warns OT Operators to Pause AI Rush Due to Security Risks
items.summary: On December 23, 2025, CISA and an international coalition urged operational technology operators to assess security risks before adopting AI, highlighting vulnerabilities in the rush to implement the technology.

items.title: UK Cyber Centre: Prompt Injection Attacks on Generative AI May Never Be Fully Mitigated
items.summary: The UK National Cyber Security Centre warned that prompt injection attacks against generative AI applications could never be totally eliminated, as noted in recent coverage.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Epic Games Store Reveals December 23 Mystery Free Game: Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night
items.summary: The Epic Games Store's seventh holiday 2025 free mystery game is the critically acclaimed side-scrolling RPG Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night, available to claim for 24 hours until December 24, 2025, at 16:00 UTC. The game features fluid combat, gothic visuals, and memorable boss fights but has noted issues with grinding and pacing.

items.title: Speculation Builds for Epic Games Store's 8th Mystery Free Game on December 24
items.summary: YouTubers and fans speculate the eighth Epic Games Store holiday mystery game, dropping December 24, 2025, could be a multiplayer title or a big surprise to build hype toward Christmas.

items.title: IShowSpeed Fortnite Skin Reportedly Leaked for Winterfest 2025 Release
items.summary: Dataminers leak a potential IShowSpeed Fortnite Icon skin bundle launching December 24, 2025, at 4 PM PT as part of Winterfest 2025, though confirmation is unverified and speculation ties to his teaser.

items.title: Reports: Call of Duty Co-Creator Vince Zampella Dies in Car Crash
items.summary: Vince Zampella, co-creator of the Call of Duty franchise, has reportedly died in a car crash, as announced by multiple outlets citing gaming industry sources.

items.title: South of Midnight Named Personal Xbox Game of the Year 2025 by Reviewer
items.summary: A Pure Xbox reviewer crowns Xbox Game Studios' narrative adventure South of Midnight as their 2025 Game of the Year for its memorable story, surpassing other hits like Clair Obscur and DOOM: The Dark Ages.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
